title: Dayton Aviation Heritage National Historical Park: Explore Dayton's Aviation Places
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Places To Go     Explore Dayton's Aviation Places              Explore Dayton's Aviation Places           Click the image to download a map and stamp sheet.   Earn a free Aviation Trail water bottle    Hike, Run, or Bike to at least six of the participating twelve sites located around Dayton and collect a stamp at each stop. Return the stamped portion of the form in person or by mail to the Wright-Dunbar Interpretive Center and claim your Aviation Trail water bottle! Download a copy of the Miami Valley Ohio Bikeways Map for more information on the region's bike trails. Learn more about Dayton's aviation sites when you visit the Aviation Trail.   Remember to follow the rules of the road on and on the bike path. Always yield to foot traffic. Wear a helmet at all times and use lights in low visibility. Take plenty of water with you and plan for changes in the weather. Look for trail signage along the way, and familiarize yourself with roads and landmarks along your route. Visit the park's Bike with a Ranger page or Contact Us to find out how you can sign up to ride with a park ranger.   Stamp Sheet & Map  Download a PDF version of the stamp sheet which also includes a map of 12 Aviation Trail places that you can bike, hike or run to.
